thread.title: Mattel (MAT) Stock Down in After-Hours Trading on Earnings Miss - TheStreet
thread.title_full: Mattel (MAT) Stock Down in After-Hours Trading on Earnings Miss - TheStreet

author: yahoo
title: Mattel (MAT) Stock Down in After-Hours Trading on Earnings Miss - TheStreet
text:
Reddit Email Print Reprint NEW YORK ( TheStreet ) --  Mattel ( MAT - Get Report ) stock is declining by 2.17% to $22.04 in after-hours trading on Thursday, following the company's lower than expected earnings results for the 2015 third quarter, which were impacted by unfavorable currency exchanges.
The company posted adjusted earnings of 71 cents per share for the quarter ended September 30, down from 98 cents for the same period last year.
Revenue dropped by 11% to $1.79 billion, compared with $2.02 billion for the third quarter of 2014, as sales fell across all brands, including Barbie, Fisher-Price and American Girl.

Analysts had estimated for earnings of 80 cents per share on revenue of $1.89 billion for the latest quarter.
"Our results for the quarter, excluding the significant impact from currency exchange rates, were broadly in line with our expectations at this stage of our turnaround," CEO Christopher Sinclair said in a statement.
Separately, TheStreet Ratings team rates MATTEL INC as a Hold with a ratings score of C. TheStreet Ratings Team has this to say about their recommendation:
We rate MATTEL INC (MAT) a HOLD. The primary factors that have impacted our rating are mixed - some indicating strength, some showing weaknesses, with little evidence to justify the expectation of either a positive or negative performance for this stock relative to most other stocks. The company's strengths can be seen in multiple areas, such as its reasonable valuation levels, expanding profit margins and largely solid financial position with reasonable debt levels by most measures. However, as a counter to these strengths, we also find weaknesses including feeble growth in the company's earnings per share, deteriorating net income and weak operating cash flow.
You can view the full analysis from the report here: MAT
